member.summary: Represents a fully parsed llms.txt document. This is the primary output of .

remarks.para: The document model is immutable once constructed. The parser produces it; consumers read it. This makes instances safe for caching and concurrent access.

The parser uses lenient parsing: it extracts whatever structure it can from the input and records any issues as entries in the collection. A document with diagnostics is still usable — callers decide their own strictness threshold.

The blockquote content immediately following the H1, or null if no blockquote was present.

The ordered list of H2-delimited sections.

member.name: T:LlmsTxtKit.Core.Parsing.LlmsDocumentParser
member.summary: Parses raw llms.txt content into a strongly-typed .

remarks.para: The parser is behaviorally aligned with the reference Python implementation (miniparse.py from AnswerDotAI/llms-txt). Key behavioral details:

list.item: Sections are delimited by H2 headings only (^##\s+). H3+ headings are treated as content within the parent section.
The blockquote summary captures a single line (^>\s*(.+)$).
The "Optional" section check is case-sensitive and exact-match.
Freeform content between the blockquote and first H2 is captured as a single blob (the "info" field in the reference implementation).

remarks.para: The parser never throws on malformed input. Instead, it returns an with whatever it could extract, plus entries for any issues encountered. Only programming errors (null input) throw exceptions.
